inputs:
Q: Which of the following sentences relating to ideas does not use metaphorical language that could also be applied to fashions?
  choice: Old-fashioned notions have no place in today's society.
  choice: What are the new trends in English criticism?
  choice: Many of the branches of mathematics are old.
  choice: Semiotics has become quite chic.
A:
targets: Many of the branches of mathematics are old.
multiple_choice_targets: What are the new trends in English criticism?
Old-fashioned notions have no place in today's society.
Semiotics has become quite chic.
Many of the branches of mathematics are old.

inputs:
Q: Which of the following sentences relating to ideas does not use metaphorical language that could also be applied to money?
  choice: He's rich in ideas.
  choice: This innovative book presents new ideas on the topic.
  choice: Let me add my two cents.
  choice: He has a wealth of ideas.
  choice: That book is a treasure trove of ideas.
A:
targets: This innovative book presents new ideas on the topic.
multiple_choice_targets: Let me add my two cents.
He's rich in ideas.
That book is a treasure trove of ideas.
He has a wealth of ideas.
This innovative book presents new ideas on the topic.

inputs:
Q: Which of the following sentences relating to life does not use metaphorical language that could also be applied to gambling?
  choice: He lives a healthy life.
  choice: The odds are against me in this world.
  choice: He is holding all the aces in life.
  choice: It's a toss-up which of the two life paths she’ll follow.
A:
multiple_choice_targets: The odds are against me in this world.
He is holding all the aces in life.
It's a toss-up which of the two life paths she’ll follow.
He lives a healthy life.

inputs:
Q: Which of the following sentences relating to ideas does not use metaphorical language that could also be applied to fashions?
  choice: That idea is old hat!
  choice: That's an old idea worth revisiting now.
  choice: Marxism is currently fashionable in western Europe.
  choice: That idea went out of style years ago.
A:
targets: That's an old idea worth revisiting now.
multiple_choice_targets: That idea went out of style years ago.
Marxism is currently fashionable in western Europe.
That idea is old hat!
That's an old idea worth revisiting now.

inputs:
Q: Which of the following sentences relating to ideas does not use metaphorical language that could also be applied to products or commodities?
  choice: It is important to write down your ideas.
  choice: There is always a market for good ideas.
  choice: How you package your ideas is important.
  choice: That's a worthless idea.
A:
targets: It is important to write down your ideas.
multiple_choice_targets: How you package your ideas is important.
There is always a market for good ideas.
That's a worthless idea.
It is important to write down your ideas.

inputs:
Q: Which of the following sentences relating to arguments does not use metaphorical language that could also be applied to buildings?
  choice: We need some more facts or the argument will fall apart.
  choice: We need to construct a strong argument for that.
  choice: The argument is shaky.
  choice: We need to analyze the arguments.
A:
targets: We need to analyze the arguments.
multiple_choice_targets: The argument is shaky.
We need some more facts or the argument will fall apart.
We need to construct a strong argument for that.
We need to analyze the arguments.

  choice: It will take years for that idea to come to full flower.
  choice: That idea went out of fashion years ago.
  choice: He views chemistry as a mere offshoot of physics.
  choice: Mathematics has many branches.

targets: That idea went out of fashion years ago.
multiple_choice_targets: It will take years for that idea to come to full flower.
